titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Tisch School of the Arts Department of Photography and Imaging RG.35.5
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-11-22 16:26:46 -0500.

change.item: Record updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2019 accretions

did.unittitle: Records of the Tisch School of the Arts Department of Photography and Imaging

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: Tisch School of the Arts. Department of Photography and Imaging

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Tisch School of the Arts. Department of Photography and Imaging

physdesc.extent: in 16 record cartons, 3 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box 1 oversize flat box, 1 media box

did.abstract: The Department of Photography and Imaging at the NYU Tisch School of the Arts is a four-year BFA program focused on the making and understanding of images through an arts curriculum grounded in liberal arts education. Students and faculty in the department work in varied modes of analog and digital photo-based image making and multimedia. This collection consists of materials created and collected by the Department of Photography and Imaging at the NYU Tisch School of the Arts from the late 1980s through the 2010s, and includes catalogs, programs from exhibitions, and copies of ISO magazine. The collection also includes audio and video recordings in both analog and electronic format of the department's events, guest lectures, and panel sessions, as well as examples the department's film library of commercial releases.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials created and collected by the Department of Photography and Imaging at the NYU Tisch School of the Arts from the late 1980s through the 2010s, and includes catalogs, programs from exhibitions, and copies of ISO magazine. The collection also includes audio and video recordings in both analog and electronic format of the department's events, guest lectures, and panel sessions, as well as examples the department's film library of commercial releases.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Department of Photography and Imaging at the NYU Tisch School of the Arts is a four-year BFA program focused on the making and understanding of images through an arts curriculum grounded in liberal arts education. Students and faculty in the department work in varied modes of analog and digital photo-based image making and multimedia.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by New York University are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Tisch School of the Arts Department of Photography and Imaging in September 2017; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2019.037. Accretions were transferred in November 2019; the accession numbers associated with these transfers are 2019.120 and 2019.121.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Tisch School of the Arts Department of Photography and Imaging Publications; RG 35.5; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level with a box-list inventory. Born-digital items were identified and inventoried, but have not yet been forensically imaged, analyzed, or described. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact [repository name, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596] with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596] with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
